Hey YIFY . . . Seriously man, your uploads are absolutely the very best out there.  Period.  The quality is amazing and the small sizes are almost unbelievable.

But . . . I think that there is something seriously flawed with this particular upload of Red October.

I have downloaded it three different times, on three different 'puters, and have attempted to play it on six different machines all running different OS's.  

It plays fine in the VLC player and in the FinalMediaPlayer but will not play at all in the DIVX player or in Windows Media Player.  On one of my machines, it totally locks up Windows 7 if I just single click on the name of the file in Windows Explorer.

All of your other MKV files play without fail on all of my machines except this one particular file.

What am I missing?
Amazing quality for such a small size. Thank you for this.

DOWNLOADERS NOTE: This file (and several others by the same uploader) contain a video stream that some hardware players cannot play. (The audio stream works fine.) Software-based players (like VLC) seem unaffected by the problem and work fine. If you plan to use a hardware-based player, test it before you spend a lot of time downloading!
